articles.title: Project
articles.contents:
Contents
Observatory of Rural Dynamics and Inequalities in South India

Observatory of Rural Dynamics and Inequalities in South India
Coordinated by Dr Isabelle Guérin and Dr Christophe J. Nordman, the ODRIIS Observatory is housed by the research program “Household vulnerabilities, labour and socioeconomic dynamics” in the Social Departments of the French Institute of Pondicherry. ODRIIS aims to analyses how structural changes in contemporary India are reshaping the organisation of work, social hierarchies and household livelihoods. The observatory combines different tools through a collection of projects to help understand these socio-economic changes under different lights. We have been collecting quantitative panel data on households and individuals in rural South India via the NEEMSIS Survey. We also use a variety of socio-economic methods (financial diaries, village monographs, life stories, video documentaries, etc). Beyond the regional analysis, the ODRIIS Observatory intends to contribute to the theoretical renewal of the concepts of work, networks, skills, debt and financialisation.



Figure 1: Family from Manapakkam, India.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
In progress
Publications in peer-reviewed journals
Reports
Unpublished works

In progress
Natal, A. Psychology of Debt in Rural Tamil Nadu, India (Thesis chapter). Bordeaux, France: University of Bordeaux.
See the poster here.
See the complete bibliography here.

Natal, A. & Nordman, C.J. Measure and (In)stability Over Time of Cognitive Skills and Personality Traits in Rural India (Thesis chapter). Bordeaux, France: University of Bordeaux.
Natal, A. & Nordman, C.J. Persistence of Over-Indebtedness in Rural India (Thesis chapter). Bordeaux, France: University of Bordeaux.
Publications in peer-reviewed journals
Guérin, I., Michiels, S., Natal, A., Nordman, C. J., & Venkatasubramanian, G. (2022). Surviving Debt, Survival Debt in Times of Lockdown. Economic & Political Weekly, 57(1), 41–49. Full article here.
Reports
Nordman, C. J., Guérin, I., Michiels, S., Natal, A., & Venkatasubramanian, G. (2019). NEEMSIS Survey Report: A Full Statistical Picture of the Household and Individual Data (Survey report). Paris, France and Pondicherry, India: French Institute of Pondicherry (IFP) and French National Research Institute for Sustainable Development (IRD). Retrieved from https://neemsis.hypotheses.org/ressources/statistical-report
Unpublished works
Natal, A. (2019). Impact of marriage on the over-indebtedness of rural household in Tamil Nadu: an analysis by conditional diff-in-diff matching (M.A. dissertation). Bordeaux, France: University of Bordeaux. In french.
Natal, A., Cachau, D., Couvin, A., Apedo, A., Aziadeke, A., & Atiego-Noglo, C. Y. (2018). Feasibility study of REDD+ recommendations in the Danyimé area, Togo (Survey report). Adéta, Togo: NGO FAGAD. In french.
Cachau, D. & Natal, A. (2018). Impact of microfinance on women’s empowerment (M.A. dissertation). Bordeaux, France: University of Bordeaux. In french.
